paintings.name: Three Studies for Figures at the Base of a Crucifixion
paintings.description: This triptych features three distorted figures against a stark, black background. The figures are reminiscent of traditional religious icons, but their twisted forms create a sense of unease and horror.

paintings.name: Study after Velázquez's Portrait of Pope Innocent X
paintings.description: Bacon reimagines Velázquez's original painting with his signature style, featuring a screaming, distorted pope. The painting is one of Bacon's most famous works and is considered a masterpiece of 20th-century art.

paintings.name: Second Version of Triptych 1944
paintings.description: This later version of Bacon's original triptych features even more exaggerated and distorted figures, depicting the violence and horror of war. The painting is a powerful commentary on the brutality of human conflict.

paintings.name: Portrait of Lucian Freud
paintings.description: Bacon's portrait of his friend and fellow artist Lucian Freud is one of his most famous works. The painting features a twisted and contorted depiction of Freud's face, conveying a sense of psychological tension and anxiety.

paintings.name: Head VI
paintings.description: Part of a series of 'head' portraits that Bacon created in the late 1940s, 'Head VI' features a grotesque and distorted depiction of the human head. The painting is a powerful expression of the artist's interest in the darker aspects of human psychology.
